FuncDef:
The set service-class command configures the service class for EXP values in MPLS headers.
The undo set service-class command cancels the configuration.
By default, the EXP values in MPLS headers are mapped to the service class BE.
CLIs: set service-class { af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | be | cs6 | cs7 | ef } { inbound | outbound }
undo set service-class [ af1 | af2 | af3 | af4 | be | cs6 | cs7 | ef ] { inbound | outbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the service class to be AF1.
-

Specifies the service class to be AF2.
-

Specifies the service class to be AF3.
-

Specifies the service class to be AF4.
-

Specifies the service class to be BE.
-

Specifies the service class to be CS6.
-

Specifies the service class to be CS7.
-

Specifies the service class to be EF.
-

Specifies the packets to be decrypted.
-

Specifies the packets to be encrypted.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a packet enters an MPLS network, both the DSCP value of IP headers and EXP value of MPLS headers in the packets are mapped to service classes. To allow only the EXP value of MPLS headers to be modified, run the set service-class command.
Configuration Impact
Only the EXP values of MPLS headers are mapped to service classes.
